author: Francisco-Gamino
body: Resolves issue #2271 - Implement Get-Help -Online for .NET Core on Windows, Nano Server, and IoT

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi **@Francisco-Gamino**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution!

It looks like you're a Microsoft contributor (Francisco Gomez Gamino). If you're full-time, we DON'T require a Contribution License Agreement. If you are a vendor, please DO sign the electronic Contribution License Agreement. It will take 2 minutes and there's no faxing! https://cla.microsoft.com.

TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: vors
comments.body: Can we add a negative tests (i.e. trying to open misformatted help URL) to verify that we behave consistently across platforms?

comments.author: jpsnover
comments.body: What is going to happen when you run this on macOS or Linux?

comments.author: vors
comments.body: @jpsnover it's handled by `#if UNIX` case above

comments.body: @Francisco-Gamino we are currently waiting on you to address the review comments. Please let us know if you have any concerns on the comments.

comments.author: daxian-dbw

title: Fixing get-help <cmdletName> -online for .NET Core on Desktop.
